intro: Koanophyllon simile, commonly known as the slenderleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Its small, yellow to orange flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Koanophyllon simile is often found in open grasslands and along disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
